page.title: 02CHURCH LIFE ASTON & WESTON
page.content: THE TWO CHURCHES OF ASTON AND WESTON FORM THE UNITED BENEFICE OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND AND THEREFORE SHARE THE SAME RECTOR, WHO IS ALSO CHAPLAIN OF THE HOSPITAL AT ASTON. BOTH CHURCHES HAVE ANCIENT BUILDINGS WITH NORMAN FOUNDATIONS. THE CHURCH IN ASTON HOLDS 3 SERVICES EACH SUNDAY;8A.M.HOLY COMMUNION,1030 FAMILY SERVICE OR SUNDAY SCHOOL; 6.30P.M.EVENSONG. THE CHURCH IS ALSO A CENTRE FOR YOUNG WIVES, THE MOTHERS' UNION AND A MOTHERS AND TODLERS GROUP. IN WESTON THE CHURCH IS SOME DISTANCE FROM THE VILLAGE BECAUSE THE MODERN VILLAGE GREW AROUND THE RAILWAY RATHER THAN THE CHURCH, WHICH NOW HOLDS ONE SERVICE A WEEK, SUNG EUCHARIST AT 9A.M. BOTH VILLAGES ALSO HAVE METHODIST CHAPELS WHICH PROVIDE WORSHIP AND ACTIVITIES FOR YOUNG PEOPLE.WESTON'S GIRLS BRIGADE IS GOODA
